query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 «Poscia che Costantin l’aquila volse 2 contr’ al corso del ciel, ch’ella seguio 3 dietro a l’antico che Lavina tolse,
query.error: **English:** 1 "After Constantine turned the eagle 2 against the course of the heavens, which it had followed 3 behind the ancient one who took Lavinia,
query.result: 1 "Wosa ky Constantine an er ow trehevis 2 yn erbyn kours an nef, an er a sewya 3 wosa an koth a gemeras Lavinia,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 cento e cent’ anni e più l’uccel di Dio 5 ne lo stremo d’Europa si ritenne, 6 vicino a’ monti de’ quai prima uscìo;
query.error: **English:** 4 for a hundred and a hundred years and more the bird of God 5 remained in the farthest west of Europe, 6 near the mountains from which it first came forth;
query.result: 4 kans ha kans vledhen ha moy an edhen a Dhew 5 yn pella Europa a dhiskwedhas, 6 ogas dhe'n menydhyow a-dhyworth y thens,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 e sotto l’ombra de le sacre penne 8 governò ’l mondo lì di mano in mano, 9 e, sì cangiando, in su la mia pervenne.
query.error: **English:** 7 and under the shadow of its sacred wings 8 it governed the world there from hand to hand, 9 and, thus changing, it came into my possession.
query.result: 7 ha dan skedhans y edhenow sans 8 a renas an bys ena a-dhyworth an erel, 9 ha, vel dh'y chanjya, dhe'n vy pervedhas."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Cesare fui e son Iustinïano, 11 che, per voler del primo amor ch’i’ sento, 12 d’entro le leggi trassi il troppo e ’l vano.
query.error: **English:** 10 I was Caesar and I am Justinian, 11 who, through the desire of the first love that I feel, 12 removed the excessive and the vain from within the laws.
query.result: 10 Me a veu Cesar ha my yw Justinian, 11 neb, rag an garow a'n kynsa karanteth, 12 a-dhyworth an lesow my a dhyskiis an moy ha'n fals.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 E prima ch’io a l’ovra fossi attento, 14 una natura in Cristo esser, non piùe, 15 credea, e di tal fede era contento;
query.error: **English:** 13 And before I was attentive to the work, 14 I believed that there was only one nature in Christ, 15 and I was content with that faith;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 ma ’l benedetto Agapito, che fue 17 sommo pastore, a la fede sincera 18 mi dirizzò con le parole sue.
query.error: **English:** 16 but the blessed Agapetus, who was 17 the supreme shepherd, directed me 18 to the true faith with his words.
query.result: 16 mes an benygys Agapitus, neb a veu 17 an moy pastores, dhe'n feyth pur 18 ow trehevis gans y gerow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Io li credetti; e ciò che ’n sua fede era, 20 vegg’ io or chiaro sì, come tu vedi 21 ogni contradizione e falsa e vera.
query.error: **English:** 19 I believed him; and that which was in his faith, 20 I now see as clearly as you see 21 every contradiction, both false and true.
query.result: 19 My a gredyas; ha henna a veu yn y feyth, 20 my a welav ena klear, dell ty a wel 21 pub kontraritedh, fals ha gwir.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Tosto che con la Chiesa mossi i piedi, 23 a Dio per grazia piacque di spirarmi 24 l’alto lavoro, e tutto ’n lui mi diedi;
query.error: **English:** 22 As soon as I set out with the Church, 23 it pleased God, through grace, to inspire me 24 with the great work, and I devoted myself entirely to it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 e al mio Belisar commendai l’armi, 26 cui la destra del ciel fu sì congiunta, 27 che segno fu ch’i’ dovessi posarmi.
query.error: **English:** 25 and I entrusted my armies to my Belisarius, 26 to whom the right hand of heaven was so joined, 27 that it was a sign that I should rest.
query.result: 25 ha dhe'm Belisarius ow commendyas an armyow, 26 dhe'n neb an dorn dhe'n nef a veu vel unys, 27 pub margh a veu vyth owth ow dhe'm posas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Or qui a la question prima s’appunta 29 la mia risposta; ma sua condizione 30 mi stringe a seguitare alcuna giunta,
query.error: **English:** 28 Now here my response comes to the first question; 29 but its nature 30 compels me to add something more,
query.result: 28 Wosa hemma dhe’n kynsa govyn 29 ow prenna’m gorra; mes y honan 30 a wra’m gorra dhe wul dhesel dhe leverel,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 perché tu veggi con quanta ragione 32 si move contr’ al sacrosanto segno 33 e chi ’l s’appropria e chi a lui s’oppone.
query.error: **English:** 31 so that you may see with how much justification 32 he who appropriates it for himself and he who opposes it 33 move against the sacrosanct sign.
query.result: 31 rag dhe weles gans pythvos kemmys 32 yma dhe omdhrehevel dhe’n arwodh sans, 33 ha henna a wra dhesel ha henna a wra dhe omdhrehevel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Vedi quanta virtù l’ha fatto degno 35 di reverenza; e cominciò da l’ora 36 che Pallante morì per darli regno.
query.error: **English:** 34 See how much virtue has made him worthy 35 of reverence; and it began from the hour 36 that Pallas died to give him kingship.
query.result: 34 Gweles kemmys yw an virtudes a wra tus ow thâl 35 a-barth; ha kovallas a-barth an our 36 pan vrovyas Pallas rag an ryogeth thâl.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Tu sai ch’el fece in Alba sua dimora 38 per trecento anni e oltre, infino al fine 39 che i tre a’ tre pugnar per lui ancora.
query.error: **English:** 37 You know that he made his dwelling in Alba 38 for three hundred years and more, until the end 39 when the three fought for him again, three against three.
query.result: 37 Ty a wydh ev a wrug y drehevel yn Alba 38 rag tri cans vledhen ha moy, bys dhe’n diwedh 39 pan vatalyas an tri rag ev, tri orth try.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 E sai ch’el fé dal mal de le Sabine 41 al dolor di Lucrezia in sette regi, 42 vincendo intorno le genti vicine.
query.error: **English:** 40 And you know that he made from the evil of the Sabines 41 to the sorrow of Lucretia in seven kings, 42 conquering the neighboring peoples all around.
query.result: 40 Ha ty a wydh ev a wrug a-dhyworth drog an Sabinedh 41 dhe’n golongh a Lucretia yn seyth myghtern, 42 ow fetha an dusow a-dro dhe’n pow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Sai quel ch’el fé portato da li egregi 44 Romani incontro a Brenno, incontro a Pirro, 45 incontro a li altri principi e collegi;
query.error: **English:** 43 You know what he did, borne by the noble 44 Romans against Brennus, against Pyrrhus, 45 against the other princes and assemblies;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 onde Torquato e Quinzio, che dal cirro 47 negletto fu nomato, i Deci e ’ Fabi 48 ebber la fama che volontier mirro.
query.error: **English:** 46 whence Torquatus and Quinctius, who from the neglected 47 curl was named Cincinnatus, the Decii and the Fabii 48 had the fame that I gladly mirror.
query.result: 46 ow syns Torquatus ha Quinctius, neb a’n bledhen 47 dibrisys veu henwys Cincinnatus, an Decii ha’n Fabii 48 a gavas an klodho a wra vy desyrgh orth mirva.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Esso atterrò l’orgoglio de li Aràbi 50 che di retro ad Anibale passaro 51 l’alpestre rocce, Po, di che tu labi.
query.error: **English:** 49 He cast down the pride of the Arabs 50 who, following Hannibal, crossed 51 the rocky Alps, Po, from which you flow.
query.result: 49 Ev a wruk dalleth baldh an Arabedh 50 a dheuth wosa Hanibal a drehedhas 51 an garrek k्रेkrek, Po, a-dhyworth ty a wra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Sott’ esso giovanetti trïunfaro 53 Scipïone e Pompeo; e a quel colle 54 sotto ’l qual tu nascesti parve amaro.
query.error: **English:** 52 Under him as youths triumphed 53 Scipio and Pompey; and to that hill 54 beneath which you were born it seemed bitter.
query.result: 52 Danedha ev y feu tryumfys y yowynk 53 Scipio ha Pompey; ha dhe’n bre dhe 54 a-dhyworth ty a dheuth, ev a sethas feth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Poi, presso al tempo che tutto ’l ciel volle 56 redur lo mondo a suo modo sereno, 57 Cesare per voler di Roma il tolle.
query.error: **English:** 55 Then, near the time when all of heaven wished 56 to return the world to its serene course, 57 Caesar, at the will of Rome, takes him.
query.result: 55 Wosa henna, ogas dhe’n termyn pan vynnas oll an nef 56 dalleth an bys dhe’n fordh dhe’y hunros, 57 Cesar, gans yns Roma, a’y kemer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 E quel che fé da Varo infino a Reno, 59 Isara vide ed Era e vide Senna 60 e ogne valle onde Rodano è pieno.
query.error: **English:** 58 And what he did from the Var to the Rhine, 59 the Isère saw and the Era and the Seine saw 60 and every valley from which the Rhône is full.
query.result: 58 Ha’n peth a wrug a-dhyworth Varo dhe’n Reno, 59 Isara a welas ha’n Era ha’n Senna a welas 60 ha pub trawon a-dhyworth yma Rodano a wra leun.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Quel che fé poi ch’elli uscì di Ravenna 62 e saltò Rubicon, fu di tal volo, 63 che nol seguiteria lingua né penna.
query.error: **English:** 61 What he did after he left Ravenna 62 and crossed the Rubicon was of such flight 63 that neither tongue nor pen could follow it.
query.result: 61 An peth a wrug wosa henna pan dheuth a-dhyworth Ravenna 62 ha lamm orth Rubicon, veu avel orth henna, 63 na yth yth esa tavos na pluen a’y sewya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Inver’ la Spagna rivolse lo stuolo, 65 poi ver’ Durazzo, e Farsalia percosse 66 sì ch’al Nil caldo si sentì del duolo.
query.error: **English:** 64 Toward Spain he turned his army, 65 then toward Dyrrhachium, and struck Pharsalus 66 so that the Nile felt the heat of the grief.
query.result: 64 Orth Spayn ev a droas y lu, 65 wosa henna orth Durazzo, ha Farsalia a daras 66 yn fordh pan dheuth an Nyl tomm a’y golongh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Antandro e Simeonta, onde si mosse, 68 rivide e là dov’ Ettore si cuba; 69 e mal per Tolomeo poscia si scosse.
query.error: **English:** 67 Antenor and Simon, where he moved, 68 he saw again and where Hector hid; 69 and evil for Ptolemy then he shook.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Da indi scese folgorando a Iuba; 71 onde si volse nel vostro occidente, 72 ove sentia la pompeana tuba.
query.error: **English:** 70 From there he descended, thundering at Juba; 71 where he turned in your occident, 72 where he heard the Pompeian trumpet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Di quel che fé col baiulo seguente, 74 Bruto con Cassio ne l’inferno latra, 75 e Modena e Perugia fu dolente.
query.error: **English:** 73 Of what he did with the following standard-bearer, 74 Brutus with Cassius in Hell yaps, 75 and Modena and Perugia were sorrowful.
query.result: 73 A'n peth a wrug gans an mab-baner war-lergh, 74 Brutus gans Cassius yn Ifarn a latra, 75 ha Modana ha Perugya a veu dolurus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Piangene ancor la trista Cleopatra, 77 che, fuggendoli innanzi, dal colubro 78 la morte prese subitana e atra.
query.error: **English:** 76 The sad Cleopatra still weeps, 77 who, fleeing before him, from the asp 78 took sudden and bitter death.
query.result: 76 Cleopatr trist a gena yn-bes, 77 hag, ow tos aga yn-dann, a'n goluber 78 a gemeras marow bysk ha feth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Con costui corse infino al lito rubro; 80 con costui puose il mondo in tanta pace, 81 che fu serrato a Giano il suo delubro.
query.error: **English:** 79 With him he ran as far as the Red Sea; 80 with him he placed the world in such peace, 81 that the doors of Janus' temple were shut.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Ma ciò che ’l segno che parlar mi face 83 fatto avea prima e poi era fatturo 84 per lo regno mortal ch’a lui soggiace,
query.error: **English:** 82 But what the sign that makes me speak 83 had done before and was to do afterwards 84 for the mortal realm that is subject to him,
query.result: 82 Mes an arwodh a wra'm ow tosow 83 a wrug kyns ha'n jydh ha'n jydh a wra 84 rag an bys marow a veu danvonys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 diventa in apparenza poco e scuro, 86 se in mano al terzo Cesare si mira 87 con occhio chiaro e con affetto puro;
query.error: **English:** 85 becomes small and obscure in appearance, 86 if it is looked at with a clear eye and pure affection 87 in the hands of the third Caesar;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 ché la viva giustizia che mi spira, 89 li concedette, in mano a quel ch’i’ dico, 90 gloria di far vendetta a la sua ira.
query.error: **English:** 88 for the living justice that inspires me 89 granted him, in the hands of the one I speak of, 90 the glory of avenging his wrath.
query.result: 88 rag an gwirvos byw a'm enev, 89 a roos dhodho, yn kehevel an neb a wra kov, 90 an gordh rag venjans dhe'y gorra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Or qui t’ammira in ciò ch’io ti replìco: 92 poscia con Tito a far vendetta corse 93 de la vendetta del peccato antico.
query.error: **English:** 91 Now marvel here at what I repeat to you: 92 then with Titus he ran to take vengeance 93 for the vengeance of the ancient sin.
query.result: 91 Mes omma ammira yn henna a wra kov: 92 wosa gans Titus ev a redya rag venjans 93 rag an venjans a'n pechod koth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 E quando il dente longobardo morse 95 la Santa Chiesa, sotto le sue ali 96 Carlo Magno, vincendo, la soccorse.
query.error: **English:** 94 And when the Lombard tooth bit 95 the Holy Church, under his wings 96 Charlemagne, conquering, came to her aid.
query.result: 94 Ha pan vras an Lombard a golgas 95 an Eglos Sans, danvon y'n eselyow, 96 Charles an Meur, ow trevesa, a'y skoesas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Omai puoi giudicar di quei cotali 98 ch’io accusai di sopra e di lor falli, 99 che son cagion di tutti vostri mali.
query.error: **English:** 97 Now you can judge those 98 whom I accused above and their faults, 99 which are the cause of all your troubles.
query.result: 97 Omma ylli keworra orth an re beunans 98 a wra kov ow tosow ha'ga kammfallow, 99 a veu an acheson a'gas oll an gwella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 L’uno al pubblico segno i gigli gialli 101 oppone, e l’altro appropria quello a parte, 102 sì ch’è forte a veder chi più si falli.
query.error: **English:** 100 One opposes the yellow lilies to the public standard, 101 and the other appropriates it for himself, 102 so that it is hard to see who sins more.
query.result: 100 An eyl a wra'n arwodh publyk an liliow melyn 101 yn-dann, ha'n aral a wra'n ow approprïes, 102 byttegas kalessa orth pyw a wra moyha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Faccian li Ghibellin, faccian lor arte 104 sott’ altro segno, ché mal segue quello 105 sempre chi la giustizia e lui diparte;
query.error: **English:** 103 Let the Ghibellines do their work, do their art 104 under another sign, for he who departs 105 from justice and him always follows badly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 e non l’abbatta esto Carlo novello 107 coi Guelfi suoi, ma tema de li artigli 108 ch’a più alto leon trasser lo vello.
query.error: **English:** 106 and let not this new Charles strike him down 107 with his Guelphs, but let him fear the claws 108 that tore the hide from a prouder lion.
query.result: 106 Ha na wra'n Charles nowydh-ma hemma 107 gans y'n Guelphs, mes gorra'n dowtya'n klow 108 a dhrehas an vras leon y'n vlew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Molte fïate già pianser li figli 110 per la colpa del padre, e non si creda 111 che Dio trasmuti l’armi per suoi gigli!
query.error: **English:** 109 Many times have the sons wept 110 for the father’s fault, and let it not be believed 111 that God changes his arms for their lilies!
query.result: 109 Lies meur a-vri'n mebyon gweleis 110 rag an tas a'n tas, ha na wra credys 111 bos chanjya Dew y'n armov rag y'n lilies!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Questa picciola stella si correda 113 d’i buoni spirti che son stati attivi 114 perché onore e fama li succeda:
query.error: **English:** 112 This little star is adorned 113 with the good spirits who were active 114 so that honor and fame might follow them:
query.result: 112 An steren vyghan-ma a wra gweresys 113 gans an spyrys da a veu gweithadow 114 rag onor ha klodh a wra'n orth yntons:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 e quando li disiri poggian quivi, 116 sì disvïando, pur convien che i raggi 117 del vero amore in sù poggin men vivi.
query.error: **English:** 115 and when desires rise here, 116 thus straying, it is necessary that the rays 117 of true love rise less vividly above.
query.result: 115 Ha pan vojya'n desirs dhe'n poynt-na, 116 ow tiskwedhes, ytho gorra bos 117 an gwawlow a'n karantewir gwir dhe'n poynt-na.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Ma nel commensurar d’i nostri gaggi 119 col merto è parte di nostra letizia, 120 perché non li vedem minor né maggi.
query.error: **English:** 118 But in the measuring of our wages 119 with merit is part of our joy, 120 because we see them neither less nor greater.
query.result: 118 Mes y'n mesura'n agan gwobr 119 gans an merth yw rann a'gan lowena, 120 rag ny welon ni na le mayer na moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Quindi addolcisce la viva giustizia 122 in noi l’affetto sì, che non si puote 123 torcer già mai ad alcuna nequizia.
query.error: **English:** 121 Hence living justice sweetens 122 the affection in us so that it cannot 123 ever be turned to any wickedness.
query.result: 121 Dre henna ytho'n gwirvos byw a wra 122 ow hallowes an affection ynni, lemmyn 123 ny wra bos troha dhe nebes nebesow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Diverse voci fanno dolci note; 125 così diversi scanni in nostra vita 126 rendon dolce armonia tra queste rote.
query.error: **English:** 124 Diverse voices make sweet notes; 125 thus diverse stations in our life 126 render sweet harmony among these wheels.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 E dentro a la presente margarita 128 luce la luce di Romeo, di cui 129 fu l’ovra grande e bella mal gradita.
query.error: **English:** 127 And within this present pearl 128 shines the light of Romeo, whose 129 great and beautiful work was ill-rewarded.
query.result: 127 Ha bys y'n an margarit-ma a-lemmyn 128 a wra'n goleu goleu Romeo, pyth 129 veu y'n ober magh ha brav drog vynys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Ma i Provenzai che fecer contra lui 131 non hanno riso; e però mal cammina 132 qual si fa danno del ben fare altrui.
query.error: **English:** 130 But the Provençals who acted against him 131 have not laughed; and therefore he who 132 harms himself by doing good to others walks badly.
query.result: 130 Mes an Provençals a wrug yn erbyn 131 nyns eusons ket râs; ha dre henna 132 neb a wra gwruthyl drok dhe'n honen gwell ober dhe'n aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Quattro figlie ebbe, e ciascuna reina, 134 Ramondo Beringhiere, e ciò li fece 135 Romeo, persona umìle e peregrina.
query.error: **English:** 133 Four daughters he had, and each a queen, 134 Raymond Berenger, and this was done for him 135 by Romeo, a humble and foreign man.
query.result: 133 Peder vab a veu, ha pubonan reyn, 134 Ramondo Beringhiere, ha henna veu gwreys 135 gans Romeo, den gwyrdhek ha estren.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 E poi il mosser le parole biece 137 a dimandar ragione a questo giusto, 138 che li assegnò sette e cinque per diece,
query.error: **English:** 136 And then the wicked words moved him 137 to demand justice from this just man, 138 who assigned him seven and five for ten,
query.result: 136 Ha wosa henna an gerow bôs 137 dhe vynna reson a'n gwirvos-ma, 138 neb a ros orth seyth ha pymp rag deg,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 indi partissi povero e vetusto; 140 e se ’l mondo sapesse il cor ch’elli ebbe 141 mendicando sua vita a frusto a frusto,
query.error: **English:** 139 then he departed poor and old; 140 and if the world knew the heart he had 141 begging his life bit by bit,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 assai lo loda, e più lo loderebbe».
query.error: **English:** 142 it would praise him much, and would praise him more.
query.result: 142 ytho'n wra'n y'n kanna moy, ha moy ytho'n wra'n y'n kanna.
